What path will you choose?
​Now enrolling grades 6-12.

a.span: continuity of learning and covid-19 response plan

span.span: Detroit Public Safety Academy is accepting enrollment applications for 2019-2020, grades 6-12

br.span: Detroit Public Safety Academy does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the non-discrimination policies: Isaiah Pettway, School Leader, 1250 Rosa Parks Blvd., 313.965.6916, isaiah.pettway@leonagroup.com

td.div:
The Detroit Public Safety Academy, authorized by Eastern Michigan University, is the first (and only) school of its kind in Michigan.
Along with excellent academics, students learn about careers in Law Enforcement, Fire, Emergency Medical Services and others.
We partner with Federal, State and Local public safety agencies such as; Detroit Police Department, Detroit Fire Department, Wayne County Sheriff, Michigan State Police, US Border Patrol, Federal Emergency Management Agency, US Coast Guard, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, US Marshals and more.
Our cadets earn certificates in various courses related to public safety as well as college credits toward an advanced degree.
Detroit Public Safety Academy is very proud of its Character Education component as well. Students will learn the importance of qualities such as Leadership, Initiative, Responsibility, Teamwork, Integrity, Sacrifice, and Respect.

Currently, students enrolled at DPSA have the opportunity to take both core and elective courses online. For more information please see the following links:
Odyssey Ware
E Dynamic Learning
Google Classroom
